info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:09PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Luna and southwestern Dona Ana Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 708 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles east of Columbus, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Outflow winds may lift dust and reduce visibilities making driving difficult. Also heavy rain may cause arroyos to run, and water to flow across low water crossing along highway 9. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Carzalia Valley and Camel Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
